WRITING.TEXT: "When I was your age, *I* had to actually drive my car!"
They'd find out that a majority of the time, I have no idea what the fuck I'm doing.

Anthea. I rarely ever hear of someone having that name. I know it was someone's name on a TV show I used to watch (I think it may have been Skins UK) and then I have a friend with that name. I think it's very pretty.
http://imgur.com/U97LonX - My dad's coworker took our dogs in while my family and I were on vacation last week. It seems Rex and the baby were very interested in each other.
I did that for the first day at San Diego Comic Con last year. I 100% recommend it.
I saw that too. I've managed to block most of that out.
I just kind of explained what it was before I told the joke. Basically, the best way to explain aerial silks is, "You know cirque de solei shows? That."
Oh man I saw that. It's fucking weird.

WRITING.TITLE: What is the most disturbing film you've ever seen and why?
WRITING.TEXT: It doesn't necessary have to be a scary film.
The end of [Cherry](https://youtu.be/VasKOP-R8mA).

I had an extra pass for SDCC last year (2014) that was free (thanks to my cousin) and I ended up offering to give it to Matt Lieberman (a host at SourceFed) since he had never been to Comic Con and didn't have a pass even though a bunch of people from the company had passes. So I gave it to him (free of charge, obviously), and it wound up getting confiscated because the name on it said Monica or something like that. It was a professional badge and he tried to get into the pro-lounge and a convention center employee busted it. The pass that *I* had wasn't even mine (it was my cousin's), so I was scared about getting mine taken too. Turns out it was perfect timing because Matt was about to leave anyway and I didn't have anyone else to give the pass to. So basically, I was really stressed out about the whole thing, but it paid off. Matt and I are now pretty good friends because of this situation. (And no, I did not get my badge confiscated).
**TL;DR: My extra pass that I gave to someone at SDCC got confiscated, but I ended up becoming pretty good friends with the person I had given it to.**
I watched It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia, so I guess I'm a horrible human being now.

Well this is one I made up myself and told at an open mic. Everyone thought it was pretty great. An important note is that I had a walking boot on because I had sprained my foot while practicing an [aerial silks](http://www.google.com/imgres?imgurl=http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/04/AerialShowgirlsTissu2.jpg/450px-AerialShowgirlsTissu2.jpg imgrefurl=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_silk h=300 w=450 tbnid=y--XlyzzQyUyrM: zoom=1 docid=9vnR11QkHMpuwM hl=en ei=JfcqVca5K9C5ogTVkoHwBQ tbm=isch client=safari ved=0CCEQMygEMAQ) combo: "I sprained my foot doing aerial... But it's okay, she was worth it." (I'd like to add that I told that joke in front of my parents and family friends. My mom got mad, but my dad was proud of me.)
"Here's to not getting arrested." - Jack Barakat. That's my senior quote and it definitely applies to me.
I guess my fetish is [r/dubai](http://www.reddit.com/r/dubai/).
8dayz by Megan Lee. There's a [Korean version](https://youtu.be/lC4kLPBZdGU), as well as an [English version](https://youtu.be/gMxW57JjunE). It's just so cheerful and incredibly catchy.
Veronica Mars. I love everything that has to do with it. I loved the movie and the spin-off series is pretty great, but I think that show definitely deserved more than 3 seasons.
"Oh, the weather outside is weather!" (Paul Rudd in Forgetting Sarah Marshall)
Human Centipede and A Serbian Film are a close tie.
Edibles. I'm sticking to smoking from now on.

There was a kid who graduated from my school last year whose name was Blade. I also know a girl whose first name is Lucy-Bleu (the last part is pronounced like 'blue') and last name is Knight. I also know a guy named Rakshit (he's Indian), but he goes by Rick. On the cooler side though, I have a friend named Nirvana, which is pretty unusual.

I think I must've been about 13. I was an early bloomer (I started wearing a training bra half way thru 4th grade and was a C cup by the time I was 13. I was also one of the tallest people in my grade up until 6th). I've worked in the fashion and entertainment industry for almost 5 years now, so I learned that guys were starting to notice me at around the age of 12 or 13. It really hit me when I was walking around at around midnight (I had gotten in a fight with my mom and left to do whatever which was really stupid) and a 40-something-yo Caucasian man in a sweatsuit approached me. I was already kind of scared at that point. He then told me I'm cute and asked my name. I told him my name was Amber (which is not my name), and he said that Amber's a beautiful name. Then he reached out at me and I stepped backward to the point where I was literally backed up against a tree trunk. Then he said, "Don't be scared, little girl." and smiled one of those really creepy smiles. Luckily, at that point, some cars started coming down the road, so he chuckled and said goodnight and walked away.
**TL;DR: Some pedo freak tried hitting on me when I was 13.**
Edit: I have now learned to say things such as "If you lay so much as a finger on me, I'll fucking break it" and "Wanna say that again? I'll make you piss blood for a week" which usually works.

I have 2 small dogs, but the one this is about is a yorkie-chihuahua mix named Libby. When I'm studying, watching TV, browsing the internet, etc., I like to keep her on my lap. This dog also loves licking any part of exposed flesh. I love her to death, but this asshole decides to constantly lick me, even though I say no and make it obvious that I'm not about that at the moment. Sometimes she stops, but most of the time, she leaps to lick me. My arm is exposed; lick. I'll pull my sleeve down and then she'll actually sit up from lying down and crane her neck to get my hand. So then I pull my hand away and she tries to jump to lick it. And then if I'm wearing shorts or something, she'll lick my legs. And if I'm totally covered, she'll proceed to lick my clothes...and my chair/couch. And she doesn't do this to anyone else on my family--only me.

I actually only used temporary dye. Like the kind that washed out right away. I was really mad at my mom because she wouldn't let me permanently dye my hair pink. She also wouldn't let me get gauges, which I did at one point, but I ended up getting up to like a size 8 I think.
Edit: My hair is actually dyed platinum blonde now, but I actually go to a hair salon to get it done professionally.
[This.](http://imgur.com/a/s6Xhb)

When I was very young (toddler years) I had very severe asthma (which lasted until around the age of 9)... And when I was 2 1/2 years old, I caught pneumonia. And as crazy as it sounds, I can remember some things from then.
